title: Coronavirus: South Africa bans alcohol sales again to combat Covid-19
description: It is one of several restrictions introduced by President Ramaphosa amid rising infection rates.

title: Wounds of Dutch history expose deep racial divide
description: Faced with protests and attacks on statues, the Dutch are struggling with a legacy of racism.

title: The woman who wants to make kids better with money
description: Louise Hill is the founder of GoHenry, which provides prepaid debit cards for children.

title: Coronavirus: Welsh pubs and cafes reopen - but only outdoors
description: Only about half of independent pubs expected to reopen Monday, with many chains staying shut.

title: How video is challenging the traditional CV
description: Personal videos are increasingly being used in the job application process.

title: Home-schooling during coronavirus: a child's verdict
description: What do Britain's children think of home-schooling during the Covid-19 pandemic?

title: India's growing Covid-19 waste challenges workers
description: Millions are using gloves and masks but safely discarding them is proving to be challenge.

title: Dunston Staiths: A symbol of the past fighting for its future
description: Reputedly Europe's largest timber structure, is there a future for Dunston Staiths?

title: 'Lockdown brought out the workaholic in me'
description: A personal trainer, an advertising agency worker and a musician share their experiences of burnout.

title: Three generations on the impact of George Floyd's death
description: Three generations of one family discuss their experiences of racism and whether things are changing.

title: Match of the Day 2: Jermaine Jenas wants social media companies to do more
description: Match of the Day 2 pundit Jermaine Jenas says social media companies must do more following the news that Wilfried Zaha received racist abuse online.

title: Man City appealing Euro ban - everything you need to know
description: BBC Sport looks forward to Monday's verdict on Manchester City's appeal against their two-year Champions League ban.

title: Bournemouth 4-1 Leicester: Leicester nowhere near Champions League level - Brendan Rodgers
description: Leicester boss Brendan Rodgers says his side are "nowhere near Champions League level" following a 4-1 thrashing by Bournemouth.

title: Bournemouth hammer 10-man Leicester to boost survival hopes
description: Bournemouth come from behind to beat 10-man Leicester City and boost their hopes of avoiding relegation from the Premier League.

title: Broad 'nowhere near done' as England player - Stokes
description: Stuart Broad is "nowhere near done" despite being left out of England's first-Test defeat by West Indies, says stand-in captain Ben Stokes.

title: England v West Indies highlights: Jermaine Blackwood propels Windies to victory in first Test
description: England lose a gripping first Test to West Indies, who were helped to a memorable four-wicket victory by Jermaine Blackwood's magnificent 95.

title: 'My team can play under pressure' - Aston Villa beat Palace to boost survival hopes
description: Aston Villa beat Crystal Palace to boost their hopes of avoiding relegation in a game including two controversial video assistant referee decisions.

title: Boy, 12, arrested over racist messages sent to Zaha
description: A 12-year-old boy has been arrested by police investigating racist messages sent to Crystal Palace forward Wilfried Zaha on social media.

title: Wolves put three past Everton to climb back into top six
description: Wolves boost their chances of claiming a place in next season's Champions League with a comprehensive home victory over Everton.

title: Coronavirus: I trust people's sense on face masks - Gove
description: Minister Michael Gove says he does not think face coverings should be mandatory in shops in England.

title: Brexit: Gove defends £705m plan for border posts and staff
description: Labour has accused the government of being underprepared, saying the money was "too little, too late".

title: Farm workers isolating after virus cases
description: The vegetable pickers and packers will remain on the farm in Herefordshire while isolating.

title: Labour joins Facebook advert boycott over 'hateful material'
description: The party says it will not advertise on the site "in solidarity with the Black Lives Matter" movement.

title: Penge murder: Man in his 30s dead after 'shooting'
description: The victim, believed to be in his 30s, was found collapsed after suffering gunshot wounds.

title: Coronavirus: Primark says no to £30m job retention bonus
description: The retailer will not apply for the state-funded scheme that pays to keep furloughed staff.

title: Covid-19 survivor, 104, gets back to crosswords and crochet
description: Grace Greenwood recovered from coronavirus while others in the care home where she lives have not.

title: Coronavirus: 'Risk, not politics' will decide border restrictions
description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon says Scotland is at risk of Covid-19 cases from elsewhere in the UK.

title: North Belfast: Arlene Foster condemns petrol bomb attacks on police
description: Police say officers came under attack from youths, some of whom were masked and threw bottles and masonry.

title: Coronavirus: Pilot returning home after two months on life support in Vietnam
description: The Scottish pilot spent more than two months on life support in Vietnam after contracting Covid-19.

title: Coronavirus: Sisters have double christening as lockdown lifts
description: Ciara Tracey and Karen Doherty are happy to have their children christened following a rule change.

title: Coronavirus: Donald Trump finally wears mask in public
description: The US president previously said he could not see himself wearing a mask in public.

title: The family social distancing for years
description: Dr Ian Banks has not held his three-year-old grandson since he was diagnosed with cystic fibrosis (CF).

title: ‘How can you talk football when you’re worried about family being shot?’
description: Christian Scotland-Williamson explains how the Black Lives Matter protests affected the Pittsburgh Steelers and why there should be more coaches like Mike Tomlin.

title: 'Afterwards, all you wanted to do was play, watch and talk sport' - when Wimbledon & World Cup finals clashed
description: BBC Sport chief sports writer Tom Fordyce relives 14 July 2019, when the Wimbledon's men's final ran alongside the men's Cricket World Cup final at Lord's.

title: My Money: 'Instead of the holiday buffet, it's egg and toast at home'
description: Priya Aiyer from Kent takes us through her week during the coronavirus pandemic.
